Label: Justification A13 - Entity Already Informed
Definition: Justification that A13 obligations for providing information do not apply as the data subject already has the information
Usage: This justification requires information on how the data subject was provided the information to satify the assertion, which can be provided as a description of comment
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A14 - Entity Already Informed
Definition: Justification that A14 obligations for providing information do not apply as the data subject already has the information
Usage: This justification requires information on how the data subject was provided the information to satify the assertion, which can be provided as a description of comment
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A14 - Fulfilment Impossible
Definition: Justification that A14 obligations for providing information are impossible to fulfill
Usage: This justification requires information for why the fulfilment is impossible, such as technical impossibility, which can be provided as a description of comment
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A14 - Disproportionate Effort
Definition: Justification that A14 obligations for providing information will require a disproportionate effort to fulfill
Usage: This justification requires information on why the effort is considered disproportionate, such as the amount of time or resources required, which can be provided as a description of comment
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A14 - Objectives Impaired
Definition: Justification that A14 obligations for providing information will (seriously) impair the objectives of the processing
Usage: This justification requires information on what objectives are being impaired and the nature of impairment, which can be provided as a description of comment
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A14 - Legally Exempted
Definition: Justification that A14 obligations for providing information is legally exempted
Usage: This justification requires information on which legal provision provides the exemption, which can be provided as a description of comment, or ideally through dpv:hasApplicableLaw to refer to the specific law or through dpv:hasLegalBasis to refer to the specific legal basis enabling this justification
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A14 - Confidentiality Compromised
Definition: Justification that A14 obligations for providing information cannot be fulfilled as the personal data must remain confidential subject to an obligation of professional secrecy regulated by Union or Member State law, including a statutory obligation of secrecy
Usage: This justification requires information on which legal provision provides the confidentiality obligation, which can be provided as a description of comment, or ideally through dpv:hasApplicableLaw to refer to the specific law or through dpv:hasLegalBasis to refer to the specific legal basis enabling this justification
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - Manifestly Unfounded
Definition: Justification that a process under A13-A22 and A34 is manifestly unfounded and therefore is being charged a fee or is being refused
Usage: This justification requires information on why the process was considered manifestly unfounded which can be expressed through the additional concepts provided such as eu-gdpr:A12LackOfIntent or eu-gdpr:A12MaliciousIntent, or which can be provided as a description of comment
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - Lack Of Intent
Definition: Justification that a request under A13-A22 and A34 is manifestly unfounded - in particular due to a lack of intent - and therefore is being charged a fee or is being refused
Usage: This justification requires information on why or how the lack of intent was assessed, which can be provided as a description of comment
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - Malicious Intent
Definition: Justification that a request under A13-A22 and A34 is manifestly unfounded - in particular due to malicious intent - and therefore is being charged a fee or is being refused
Usage: This justification requires information on why or how the malicious intent was assessed, which can be provided as a description of comment
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - Manifestly Excessive
Definition: Justification that a request under A13-A22 and A34 is manifestly excessive and therefore is being charged a fee or is being refused
Usage: This justification requires information on why or how the assessment of manifestly excessive was made, which can be provided as a description of comment
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - Identity Failure
Definition: Justification that a request under A14-21 could not be fulfiled due to lack of identity verification
Usage: For justifications where identity cannot be verified and requires additional information, eu-gdpr:A12IdentityVerificationRequired should be used
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - Identity Required
Definition: Justification that a request under A14-21 could not be fulfiled due to lack of identity verification, and therefore requires additional information to complete the identity verification request
Usage: If the purpose of this justification is to ask for identity verification, then it requires information on what information is considered as an accepable form of identity, which can ideally be expressed through dpv:Process and relevant dpv:PersonalData categories, or through a comment or description for the justification
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - Delay
Definition: Justification that the request under A15-A22 is delayed
Usage: The justification is for when the initial process, which is to be completed within one month of receipt of the request, is delayed with Art.12-3 stating a duration of two further months where necessary taking into account the complexity and number of the requests. In such cases, the controller is needed to inform the data subject of the extension within one month of receipt of the request together with the reasons for the delay - which is done through this extension. Information about expected duration of response can be provided through use of dpv:hasDuration. The specific nature of delay can be expressed through use of eu-gdpr:A12ComplexityOfRequest or eu-gdpr:A12HighVolumeOfRequest
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - Complexity
Definition: Justification that the request under A15-A22 is delayed due to complexity in fulfilling it
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - High Volume
Definition: Justification that the request under A15-A22 is delayed due to high volume of similar requestes required to be fulfilled
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A12 - Information Required
Definition: Justification that the request under A14-21 could not be fulfilled due to additional information being required
Usage: If the purpose of this justification is to ask for identity verification, then eu-gdpr:A12IdentityVerificationRequired should be used. The information required can be expressed using dpv:Process, which allows also expressing the purpose for why it is required and relevant dpv:PersonalData categories, or through a comment or description for the justification
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Justification A17 - Non-Necessity
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten is being exercised as the personal data are no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which they were collected or otherwise processed
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - No Legal Basis
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten is being exercised as the corresponding consent has been withdrawn and there is no other legal basis for the processing
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Object A21
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten is being exercised through A21 right to object where there are no overriding legitimate grounds for the processing (A21-1) or as an objection to direct marketing (A21-2)
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Unlawful Processing
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten is being exercised as the personal data have been unlawfully processed
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Legal Erasure
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten is being exercised as the personal data have to be erased for compliance with a legal obligation in Union or Member State law to which the controller is subject
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Child Data
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten is being exercised as the personal data of a child have been collected for information society services referred to in A8(1)
Contributors: Beatriz Esteves, Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Freedom Of Expression
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten could not be completed as the processing is necessary for exercising the right of freedom of expression and information
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Legally Required
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten could not be completed as the processing is required for compliance with a legal obligation
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Public Interest
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten could not be completed due to
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Official Authority
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten could not be completed due to
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Public Health
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten could not be completed due to
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Archiving
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten could not be completed due to
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit

Label: Justification A17 - Legal Claims
Definition: Justification that the A17 right to erasure or to be forgotten could not be completed due to
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit
